intro: Meriania aguaditensis, commonly known as the Guadit endemic meriania, is a shrub native to the Andean region of Colombia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments at moderate altitudes. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, and it produces small, hairy fruits. Meriania aguaditensis is of interest to botanists due to its restricted distribution and unique floral morphology.
